solution_line_template: If the two expectant dogs gave birth to {puppies_per_dog} puppies each, the total number of puppies Nalani had is {puppies_per_dog}+{puppies_per_dog}= <<{puppies_per_dog}+{puppies_per_dog}={total_puppies}>>{total_puppies}
When they came of age, Nalani sold {fraction_sold} of the dogs, a total of {fraction_sold}*{total_puppies} = <<{fraction_sold}*{total_puppies}={puppies_sold}>>{puppies_sold} dogs.

If each dog sold for ${price_per_puppy}, Nalani received {puppies_sold}*{price_per_puppy} = $<<{puppies_sold}*{price_per_puppy}={total_money_received}>>{total_money_received} from the sale of the dogs.
